timeline.bodyText: would it make sense to make it a bit more generic and have "loadRegionsFromMeta()" function (similar to loadRegionsFromInMemoryState/loadRegionsFromRSReport) as then you'd have another source to compare against - hbase:meta. Then loadRegionsFromFS() would check against that state to see if a region is merged or not.
timeline.author: timoha

replies.bodyText: Yeah, that is the idea. scanForMergedParentRegions() loads regions from meta. For merge, it is a bit special, the parent regions are deleted from meta already, the only bit left is the merge qualifers in the child region.
replies.author: huaxiangsun

replies.bodyText:
Does InMemoryState not have the needed merge info in it? If not, maybe it should.
The CatalogJanitor is what manages when merge references are let go so this scan of meta is probably necessary.
To the @timoha point, are there other places in hbckchore where we need currrent picture of hbase:meta?
replies.author: saintstack
huaxiangsun

timeline.bodyText: if it's not in in-memory database but it is in merged regions, that seems like a problem as well and should be reported?
timeline.author: timoha

replies.author: huaxiangsun

replies.bodyText: Oh, merge parents are NOT in in-memory state because they are not active. We just have this background cleaner task that is doing janitorial work on hbase:meta cleaning up meta and filesystem....
replies.author: saintstack

timeline.bodyText:
Yeah, may be no way around it given the scan for merged parents is so specialized.
This looks good.
timeline.author: saintstack

timeline.bodyText: ok. good. lets keep an eye on this one because sometimes fun, unexpected conditions when change order of operations.
timeline.author: saintstack

replies.bodyText: This happens during my test, which is doing a hbck report every 10 ms, yeah, will check the sequence to make sure it does not cause any unexpected conditions.
replies.author: huaxiangsun

replies.bodyText: I dropped this change as the fix is only targeting to a corner case for a small time window (~10ms). regionMap is being referenced in more than 100 places, it is hard to figure out every possible case.
replies.author: huaxiangsun
